page.title: 20A Raft Race on the River Dee
page.content: A raft race is held on the river in Erbistock.The race is not held every year because there is sometimes the problem of parking cars by the river.All different kinds of people enter the race.Young farmers, newspaper representatives, factory representatives, and groups of people who enter just for the fun of it.The race is interesting and often hilarious and is held on the first Sunday in September. The race starts slightly upstream from the Boat Inn and has a course of 2 miles downstream to Overton Bridge.The money raised goes to various charities and the organisers are the local Boy Scouts.Sometimes they have a Duck Race instead. People buy a plastic duck which is raced against others, the winners getting prizes.
